section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Licensing agency" means:
the Department of Human Resources; and
the Department of Juvenile Services.
"Statement of need" means an official certification of public need for the location and establishment of a residential child care program in a county issued by a licensing agency under this section.

text.section: The licensing agencies shall adopt regulations governing the issuance of statements of need.

In developing the regulations required under subsection (b) of this section, a licensing agency shall:
consider the specialized mental, physical, and behavioral health and developmental needs of children in the county or region affected by the statement of need; and
consult with stakeholders in the county or region affected by the statement of need, including:
State and local child-serving agencies;
providers of residential and community-based services for children; and
children, parents, and foster parents.

An application may not be submitted to the office and a license may not be granted by a licensing agency for a residential child care program until a licensing agency issues a statement of need for a residential child care program in a county.

In addition to the statement of need required under subsection (d) of this section, a statement of need is required before:
an existing or previously licensed residential child care program is relocated to another site;
the physical site of a residential child care program is expanded; or
the number of placements in a residential child care program is increased.
A licensing agency shall publish notice of the issuance of a statement of need in the Maryland Register.
A licensing agency may not delegate its authority to issue a statement of need.
